III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/12/25, 3 youth and a staff member were at the ALC barn on
campus. The staff member was using a nicotine vape and it was
passed around for all of the youth to use. Another staff member
was present and did not report this.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 7, 2025,
and reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 9,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A denied Staff
1 or any staff member passing a nicotine vape to her to use or any
other youth to use. Youth A reported she could not recall being at
the ALC barn within the last few months. Youth A stated some
youths are trying to get Staff 1 in trouble so are making up lies.
Youth A denied ever seeing or hearing of any youth being passed
a nicotine vape by any staff member.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 9,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B denied
Staff 1 or any staff member passing a nicotine vape to her or any
other youth to use. Youth B reported she has never seen any
staff or youth vaping on campus. Youth B stated she could not
recall the last time she was at the ALC barn. Youth B denied ever
seeing or hearing of any youth being passed a nicotine vape by
any staff member.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on May 9, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 denied ever seeing
Staff 1 provide any vapes to Youth A, Youth B, Youth C or any
other youth at the facility. Staff 2 stated she did not recall being at
the ALC barn and seeing any youth vaping or pretending to vape.
Staff 2 denied any youth reporting Staff 1 provided them with a
vape or seeing Staff 1 pass a vape to youth. Staff 2 reported she
no longer works at the facility but did not have any concerns while
working there.
2

Staff 3 was interviewed via Teams on May 14, 2025. Staff 3
reported she did not see an actual vape or smell nicotine but saw
what she thought could have been smoke coming from Youth A
and Youth B’s mouths when they were standing outside at the
ALC barn with Staff 1. Staff 3 stated it was cold outside, and it
could have been their [Youth A and Youth B] breaths. Staff 3
denied asking Staff 1 about what she saw but stated she spoke
with Supervisor about her concerns. Staff 3 reported she thought
she spoke with another staff as well but could not recall.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on May
21, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
stated Staff 3 told her she believed Youth A, Youth B, and Youth
C were vaping because of their behaviors of putting their hands up
to their mouths and smoke coming from their mouths. Supervisor
reported Staff 3 told her she [Staff 3] did not actually see a vape
but had concerns they were vaping. Supervisor reported Staff 3
shared Staff 1 was with the youths [Youth A, Youth B, and Youth
C] at the ALC barn when she [Staff 3] believed the youths were
vaping.
Supervisor reported when Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
returned from the ALC barn she met them at the door of the house
and completed a search of their belongings and self. Supervisor
denied finding any vape or smelling nicotine on any of the youths.
Supervisor stated during the search Youth A and Youth C
reported they were trying to make it look like they were vaping so
Staff 1 would get fired.
Supervisor stated she had a one-on-one conversation with Staff 1
about what Staff 3 reported seeing. Supervisor reported Staff 1
denied the youth were vaping but stated they [Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C] wanted it to look like they were vaping. Supervisor
stated Staff 1 reported she was redirecting Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C, telling them they were acting inappropriately. Supervisor
reported Staff 1 denied having a vape or providing a vape to
Youth A, Youth B, or Youth C. Supervisor denied ever hearing or
seeing Staff 1 pass a vape to any youth. Supervisor stated she
was not sure if there was any documentation of the conversation
with Staff 1 or Staff 3 as there was no credibility and no vapes
were found. Supervisor described doing room searches later that
same day for all the youth in the house and no vapes were found.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on May
21, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Therapist denied
having any knowledge of Staff 1 or any staff member passing a
3

vape to any youth. Therapist stated she feels Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C’s needs are being met by the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 21,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 denied ever
providing a vape to Youth A, Youth B, and/or Youth C at the ALC
barn. Staff 1 reported she has never given any youth a vape.
Staff 1 stated while at the ALC barn Youth C was pretending to
vape so when Youth C returned to the house Youth C was
searched. Staff 1 reported no vape was found. Staff 1 stated she
believes she put the information about the incident in the team’s
chat so staff would be aware of the incident. Staff 1 reported she
could not recall what other staff were working the day at the ALC
barn. Staff 1 stated she was never talked to by Supervisor that
day or any other day about the incident or of the concern she
[Staff 1] provided Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C a vape.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 21,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D denied ever
seeing Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C vaping or pretending to
vape while at the ALC barn. Youth D reported she has never
seen or heard of any staff providing vapes to any youth at the
facility. Youth D denied any staff member has offered her a vape.
Youth D stated staff do regular searches when youth return to the
facility and of the youths’ bedrooms.
Documents Reviewed:
• Supervisor’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary
record and Supervisor completed new hire orientation
between 12/18/2023 – 04/19/2024.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed new employee orientation training
from 09/16/2024 - 09/27/2024, which would have covered
Eagle Village’s policy regarding storage of cigarette/vapes,
code of conduct with youths, etc.
• Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 3 completed new hire orientation between
06/03/2024 - 06/21/2024.
• Eagle Village Staff Code of Conduct Policy. Policy states,
“Staff are prohibited from providing cigarette lighters,
cigarettes, vape pens, chewing tobacco, or any other
item/substance that is illegal for a minor to use or have in
their possession. If a staff uses any of these items
personally and they are brought to campus, staff shall keep
these belongings secure in a place such as locked in their
4

vehicles. Smoking and vaping are not allowed on our
campus.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, no information was provided that Staff 1 passed a vape
to any youths.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance was offered to document conversations
supervisors have with staff regarding concerns or perceived
concerns about staff’s interactions with youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
